subject: Personal Finance
title: The Japanese Lost Decades
description: Learn The Japanese Lost Decades in one minute.

hook.text: In 1989, Japan's imperial palace grounds were worth more than all California real estate. Then it all crashed.

buildup.text: Japan's asset bubble in stocks and real estate was the largest in modern history.

discovery.text: When the bubble burst in 1990, Japan entered a deflationary spiral that lasted over two decades.

twist.text: Despite zero interest rates, people wouldn't borrow or spend. Deflation made waiting profitable.

climax.text: Japan's Nikkei index didn't recover to its 1989 peak until 2024 â€” thirty-five years later.

punchline.text: Some crashes take a generation to heal.

quiz.question: How long did Japan's economic stagnation last after the bubble burst?
